intro: Pimpinella leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hemlock, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of western North America, particularly in California and Oregon. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Pimpinella leptophylla thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks.
